chart_metadata.name: rust-desk
chart_metadata.description: Rust Desk is an open-source remote desktop, and alternative to TeamViewer.

runAsContext.description: Rust Desk can run as any non-root user.

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for Rust Desk

attrs.label: Allow Only Encrypted Connections
attrs.description:
Allow only encrypted connections.</br>
Clients have to use the generated key to connect to the server.

attrs.label: Additional Relay Servers
attrs.description:
Configure additional relay servers for Rust Desk.</br>
The internal relay server will be added automatically. </br>
Format: </br> host:port

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for Rust Desk.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that Rust Desk will run as.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Rust Desk will run as.

attrs.label: NAT Type Test Port
attrs.description:
The port to use for NAT type test.</br>
Internal port will always be 21115

attrs.label: ID Registration and Hole Punching Port
attrs.description:
The port to use for ID registration and Hole punching.</br>
Internal port will always be 21116 (TCP/UDP)

attrs.label: Relay Port
attrs.description:
The port to use for relay.</br>
Internal port will always be 21117

attrs.label: Enable Web Client Ports
attrs.description:
Enable web client ports.</br>
This is only required for web clients.</br>

attrs.label: Server Web Clients Port
attrs.description:
The port to use for server web clients.</br>
Internal port will always be 21118

attrs.label: Relay Web Clients Port
attrs.description:
The port to use for relay web clients.</br>
Internal port will always be 21119

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.</br>

attrs.label: Rust Desk Data Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Rust Desk Data.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: ixVolume Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the dataset.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.label: Path
attrs.description: Path to perform ACL

attrs.label: ACL Entries
attrs.description: ACL Entries

attrs.label: ID
attrs.description: Make sure to check the ID value is correct and aligns with RunAs user context of the application

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the dataset.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: Host Path to perform ACL

attrs.label: ACL Entries
attrs.description: ACL Entries

attrs.label: ID
attrs.description: Make sure to check the ID value is correct and aligns with RunAs user context of the application

attrs.label: Force Flag
attrs.description: Enabling `Force` applies ACL even if the path has existing data

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: Additional Storage
attrs.description: Additional storage for Rust Desk.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to a persistent volume claim.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB Share (Mounts a persistent volume claim to a SMB share)

attrs.label: Read Only
attrs.description: Mount the volume as read only.

attrs.label: Mount Path
attrs.description: The path inside the container to mount the storage.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the dataset.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: Host Path to perform ACL

attrs.description: ACL Entries

attrs.description: Make sure to check the ID value is correct and aligns with RunAs user context of the application

attrs.label: Force Flag

attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.description: The configuration for the SMB Share.

attrs.description: The server for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Share

attrs.label: Domain (Optional)
attrs.description: The domain for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Password
attrs.description: The password for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Size (in Gi)
attrs.description: The size of the volume quota.

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for Rust Desk.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for Rust Desk.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

1.2.5.app_readme:
Rust Desk

Rust Desk is an open-source remote desktop, and alternative to TeamViewer.

When application is installed, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the Rust Desk directories. Afterward, the Rust Desk container will run as a non-root user (Default: 568). All mounted storage(s) will be chowned only if the parent directory does not match the configured user.
1.2.5.detailed_readme:
Rust Desk

Rust Desk is an open-source remote desktop, and alternative to TeamViewer.

When application is installed, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the Rust Desk directories. Afterward, the Rust Desk container will run as a non-root user (Default: 568). All mounted storage(s) will be chowned only if the parent directory does not match the configured user.
